subject: Workflow Routing Instructions

overview.purpose: The purpose of this document is to provide specific routing instructions for claims with edits related to Configuration Information Management (CIM), Provider Configuration Management (PCM), or Utilization Management (UM).
overview.expected_outcome: When needed, claims personnel will route claims to the correct departments to ensure prompt edit resolution.

Definitions.Definition:
A function, process and department within each Molina health plan that deals with preadmission and concurrent review of hospitalizations, certain surgeries and certain medical treatments. Typical aspects of Utilization Management include:
- Collection of data about diagnosis, required services, diagnostic test results, and symptoms
- Communication to providers and members of review outcome
- Comparison of medical information to medical necessity criteria
- Physician determination of medical necessity
- Referral of case to physician review if criteria are not met
- Review of criteria that describe the member's conditions or services to support the care request

A claims management software that interfaces with QNXT and allows Claims Examiners and other users to route a claim to a specific queue as needed, such as UMT, Medical Claims Review (MCR), PCM (Provider Configuration Management), and other functional areas that are adjunctive parts of the total claims processing cycle.

References.Document: Authorization Business Process - All States and LOBs - SOP

CIM_Related_Edits.Description: Procedure code on claim not valid for benefit
Emergency claim does not match emergency benefit
Contract Term Restriction Group validation failed

PCM_Related_Edits.Description: Provider not active for plan on DOS
[MS and TX only] Provider Watch (an alert on provider record indicating a sanctioned provider)

UM-Related Edits.Description: Remaining visits less than date span. Units not allocated
Prior Authorization is awaiting medical review
Prior Authorization dates do not match claim
Prior Authorization services do not match claim
Prior Authorization has no available units
Prior Authorization has insufficient units remaining
No available bed days on authorization

Instructions: If the edit remains, refer to the Authorization Business Process - All States and LOBs - SOP. If the edit is not addressed in that document, route the claim to UM.

RevisionSummary.Comments: In “UM-Related Edits” section, added instruction to first refer to the Authorization Business Process SOP before routing the claim to UM. Added “References” section.
Modified table in “Definitions” section. Added Note, table, and Edit #asterisks in “CIM-Related Edits”.
Removed duplicate bullet points in CIM definition.
